text:
Munich Educational Portfolio – Landeshauptstadt München search close search Enter search term start search Menu close menu navigation language City Hall Events Culture, Leisure Restaurants Shopping Sights Tourism Hotels Business Living Transportation Current language: English Deutsch Français Italiano Русский العربية 中文 Startseite City of Munich Immigration Munich Educational Portfolio Immigration Munich Educational Portfolio The Munich Educational Portfolio is a folder designed for refugees and immigrants 16 years of age or older. Step by step towards Education and Employment The Munich Educational Portfolio is a folder designed for refugees and immigrants 16 years of age or older. The folder is issued in the course of an educational assessment or in the context of educational/employment counselling. Equipped with the portfolio, refugees and immigrants can carry it along during their education and training in order to record their steps and important documents. The offices listed below can utilize it to network and plan with other educational institutions. Pre-existing as well as newly-acquired skills can be documented within. The Munich Educational Portfolio Presseamt Nagy 9.11.18 can be obtained free of charge at the following two municipal offices: IBZ Language and Employment (Department of Social Services) Franziskanerstr. 8 81669 Munich Office hours (Educational Assessment): Monday, Wednesday, Friday: 9:30 am – 12:30 pm Thursday: 1:30 pm – 5:00 pm International Educational and Vocational Counselling Service (Department of Education and Sports) Goethestr. 53 Monday – Friday: 9:00 am – 12 am + 1:00 pm – 4:00 pm Ähnliche Artikel This is a carousel with rotating cards. Use the previous and next buttons to
                                navigate, and Enter to activate cards. Vorheriger Slide Information on Brexit The United Kingdom left the European Union on January  31st, 2020. All information concerning Brexit – regulary updated. Guide for Foreign Students Registration, bank account, residence permit: A step-by-step-guide for international students arriving in Munich. Study and Research in Munich What's required to study or do research in Munich? Infos on recognition of qualifications, academic and student life, research options and contacts. summary:
Munich Educational Portfolio:
- Folder for refugees and immigrants 16 years of age or older
- Issued in educational assessment or employment counselling
- Used to record steps and important documents during education and training
- Document of pre-existing and newly-acquired skills

Available at:
- IBZ Language and Employment (Department of Social Services)
- International Educational and Vocational Counselling Service (Department of Education and Sports)

Information on:
- Brexit
- Registration, bank account, residence permit for foreign students
- Study and research in Munich
- Recognition of qualifications, academic and student life, research options and contacts

Social Media:
- Facebook: @Stadt.Muenchen
- Instagram: @stadtmuenchen
- Twitter: @StadtMuenchen
- X (Twitter): @StadtMuenchen
- Newsletter: Landeshauptstadt München

Services:
- Stadtplan (city plan)
- Fahrplan (schedules)
- Kultur (culture)
- Tourismus (tourism)
- M-Strom (electricity)
- Bürgerservice (citizen service)
- Hotels
- Kontakt (contact)
- Datenschutzbeauftragte (data protection officer)
- Barrierefreiheit (accessibility)
- Leichte Sprache (easy language)
- Gebärdensprache (sign language)
- Nutzungsbedingungen (terms and conditions)
- Presse-Service (press service)
- Impressum und Datenschutz (imprint and data protection)

Other:
- Guide for foreign students
- A step-by-step guide for international students arriving in Munich
- Information on recognition of qualifications, academic and student life, research options and contacts
- Study and research in Munich
